radiographic_examinations.findings: Enhancement of the genu and rostrum of the corpus callosum; T2-weighted signal abnormality in the white matter and cortex of the left frontal, temporal, and parietal lobes.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Resolution of these findings occurred 4 months later; however, imaging from the second admission showed edema on FLAIR images of the left anterior and medial temporal lobe and extensive enhancement in the left frontal lobe.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Showed no evidence of venous obstruction.

New white-matter changes in the internal capsule on the right, multifocal left hemispheric white-matter changes, stable encephalomalacia of the left frontal and temporal lobes, and diffuse cerebral volume loss.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: New areas of patchy enhancement and signal abnormalities were observed at the time of second admission.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Progression of previous signal abnormalities seen on T2-weighted and FLAIR images; new areas of patchy enhancement in the left temporal lobe and diffuse cord enhancement.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Continued progression of signal abnormalities noted.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Patchy consolidation of the posterior segment of the right upper lobe and consolidation of the right lower lobe.
